text:
I'm currently using ngrok, so no AWS in the way (maybe it will work once deployed to AWS, didn't get there yet).
So <@U01CFE2DVFT>, are you saying that you checked the order once, and now you build the query string in the same order?
Yeah, I had it ping the dummy server repeatedly and the ordering was consistent.
I have put it into production that way. I had also initially written the permutation-checker for six parameters as well and got really sad about doing that for every request :sob:
When I make the exact same request with the same workload from Postman, it works as usual. Has anybody faced something like this before please?
whats up with your host url?
Anyone know about integrating with click funnels?
